chat.msg: Welcome!
Thank you. Please proceed at an angle of approximately 230 degrees until you reach the island with the tiger on it.

Understood. I am currently facing approximately 230 degrees and will proceed in that direction. 
I have reached the island with the tiger on it. From here, what should be my next move?
Please go around the base of the black rock that is below the tiger and then walk over the log that can provide safe passage over to the blue-winged parrot.

Got it. I will go around the base of the black rock below the tiger and then walk over the log to reach the blue-winged parrot. 
I have successfully crossed the log and reached the island with the parrot. What should be my next move?
Please go around the top of the parrot and continue around the parrot, underneath it, then cross the set of 3 rocks (two grey rocks, 1 black rock) until you are near the green frog.

Alright, I will go around the top of the parrot and then continue around it, crossing underneath it. After that, I will cross the set of 3 rocks until I am near the green frog. 
I have reached the vicinity of the green frog. What should be my next move?

Walk at an angle of approximately 135 degrees until you have passed underneath the green frog. Take a U-turn and walk northwest so that you walk above a small clump of trees and reach the alligator. Cross the alligator.

Understood. I will walk at an angle of approximately 135 degrees to pass underneath the green frog. Then, I will take a U-turn and walk northwest, passing above a small clump of trees and eventually reaching the alligator. I will cross the alligator.
I have successfully crossed the alligator. What should be my next move?
Cross the large black rock on the island with the elephant.

Got it. I will cross the large black rock on the island with the elephant. 
I have crossed the large black rock on the island with the elephant. What should be my next move?
Cross the two grey rocks to the island with the giraffe

Understood. I will cross the two grey rocks to reach the island with the giraffe. 
I have crossed the two grey rocks and reached the island with the giraffe. What should be my next move?

chat.msg: Welcome!
Thank you. Where shall I go?
Great! Let's start by heading west. Can you see a wooden bench nearby? Go below it and let me know when you are there.
I am below the wooden bench.
Perfect! Now, cross the trail in front of you and make a left turn. Let me know when you have reached the white dog again.
I have reached the white dog again.
Nice job! Now, there should be a wooden branch crossing a river near the white dog. Cross over the branch and head south. Let me know when you've reached the next destination.
I have reached the next destination.

Awesome! Next, you will see another white dog sitting next to a red and white checkered picnic. Make sure to pass over the picnic mat, touch the bowl of berries, and continue heading west. Let me know when you've reached the next step.
I have reached the next step.
Great progress! Now, you'll come across another wooden branch crossing the river. This time, you need to cross over the branch to the north. Let me know once you've crossed the river.
I have crossed the river.

Fantastic! Now, as you continue, you'll see a green bush. Instead of touching it, circle around it from the right side. Keep going until you reach the florist stand. Let me know when you've arrived there.
I have reached the florist stand.

Wonderful! Now, turn left (west) and go below the stand. You'll come across a big bridge with two people riding a bicycle. Pass the bridge, keeping it to your left, and let me know when you've gone past it.
I have gone past it.

Excellent progress! Just after the bridge, you'll spot two elderly people sitting on a bench and reading newspapers. Take a few steps south, passing between the old people and another wooden branch. Let me know when you've reached a green bush next to the end of the wooden branch.
I have reached the green bush.
Great job! Now, continue east, making sure to stay between the branch and the bush. Let me know when you've taken a few steps in that direction.

chat.msg: Welcome!
Thank you. Please head slightly south-west, staying close to the circle of grey rocks. Stop when you reach a medium-sized bush with a brown and white dog by it.
I start at the tent and move south-west, following the circle of grey rocks. I am now at the medium-sized bush with the brown and white dog by it. What's the next instruction?

Circle south below and around the bush and dog, staying close to, or on, the brown trail. Once you have gone under the dog, circle around the top of the fire and east until you are close to two toadstools.

I circle south below and around the bush and dog, following the brown trail. Now, I am under the dog. Next, I circle around the top of the fire and head east. I stop when I am close to two toadstools. What's the next instruction?
Head slightly south-east under the toadstools along the brown trail until you are close to a blue car.
I go south-east under the toadstools along the brown trail. Now, I am close to a blue car. What's the next instruction?
Take a u-turn and follow the brown trail west, then south-east, passing two bushes on your left and then stop.
I take a u-turn and follow the brown trail west. As I continue, I reach two bushes on my left. I pass them and keep going south-east until I finally stop. What's the next instruction?
Take a short cut by crossing south-west between the telescope and a large green bush until you hit the brown trail again.
I leave my current position and cross south-west between the telescope and a large green bush. I continue on this path until I hit the brown trail again. What's the next instruction?
Continue west along the trail and then cross a circle of grey rocks until you reach the wooden cabin.

I continue west along the brown trail until I come across a circle of grey rocks. I cross the circle and keep going until I finally reach the wooden cabin. 

*finished*

chat.msg: Welcome!
Thank you. Where shall I go?
Great! Start by going under the first palm tree to the south-west. Describe what you see there.
I see a brown patched dog below me and two other palm trees near me.
Excellent! Now, turn right and cross the second palm tree. What do you see next?
I see the third palm tree, a speaker, a canoe in the distance, a ball and two rocks and the brown-patched dog.
Nice observation! Now, make a sharp left turn before the third palm tree and head southward. Let me know what you encounter along the way.
I have arrived at the largest grey rock in a set of 3 rocks by the water.
Well done! Now, we need to navigate between the big rock and the small rock. Describe what you see when you reach the water.
I see a large red crab.
Great job! Now, turn right and continue westwards in the water along the big rock. Keep going until you reach another rock. Let me know when you get there.
I am there.
Fantastic! Now, you should see a shark in the water. Make a sharp right turn to avoid it. Provide a description of what you see next.
I see a blue, yellow and white ball.
Excellent! To continue the path, go back to the land and cross between the blue-yellow-white ball and the medium rock. Describe what you see as you move north.
I see a speaker and an orange tent.

Perfect! Now, veer slightly left and head towards the north-west, crossing between the red tent on the left and the larger speaker on the right. Take your time and describe your surroundings as you progress.
I am now between the ball and the speaker. I can see a red canoe to my south-west.
Great job! Now, continue north-west and circle around the red tent in an arc. Once you complete the arc, head south towards the sea. Let me know when you reach the shore.
I have reached the shore.
Well done! Now, turn right (west) at the shore and walk below the red kayak. What do you see next?
I see a large rock and some small rocks in the water.
Excellent! Now, make a 90-degree turn to your right (north) and move along the kayak. Let me know what you find at the end of the kayak.

When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.

Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?

general_survey.answer: It makes the conversation more interesting.
general_survey.question: What do you think when others mix languages in conversation? Please explain:

general_survey.answer: I studied languages at university but have not ended up using them for work, more for leisure.
